com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest

Class RequestRecorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.RequestRecorder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Handler

    public final class RequestRecorder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Handler
    An object that records all requests.

    Normally you won't need to use this class directly, because HttpServer has a built-in instance that captures all requests. You can use it if you need to capture only a subset of requests.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MILLIS
      The default timeout for requireRequest(): 5 seconds.

      • count

        public int count()
        The number of requests currently in the queue.
        Returns:
        the number of stored requests that have not been consumed

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if the recorder is capturing requests. This is true by default.
        Returns:
        true if enabled

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether the recorder should capture requests. This is true by default.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the recorder, false to disable

      • requireRequest

        public RequestInfo requireRequest()
        Consumes and returns the first request in the queue, blocking until one is available, using DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.
        Returns:
        the request information
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timeout expires

      • requireRequest

        public RequestInfo requireRequest(long timeout,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
        Consumes and returns the first request in the queue, blocking until one is available.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum length of time to wait
        timeoutUnit - the time unit for the timeout
        Returns:
        the request information
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the timeout expires

      • requireNoRequests

        public void requireNoRequests(long timeout,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
        Asserts that there are no requests in the queue and none are received within the specified timeout.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum length of time to wait
        timeoutUnit - the time unit for the timeout
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a request was received
